This suggests that eating too much sugar may form a vicious circle, that is, eating sugar regularly will lead to a decrease in the sensitivity of taste buds to sweetness, and a decrease in satisfaction caused by eating the same amount of sugar, which will subconsciously ask for more sugar. The result is that eating too much sugar leads to obesity.Question: Which of the following options does not support the above argument?
A. A.There are criterias for evaluating the sweetness of drinks.
B. B.The volunteers were able to evaluate the sweetness of the drink more accurately.
C. C.People who like sweets often can't resist the temptation of sweetness.
D. D.Satisfaction is dominated by the subconscious.
Answer:

sampled: B. The volunteers were able to evaluate the sweetness of the drink more accurately.

data.sampled: B. The volunteers were able to evaluate the sweetness of the drink more accurately.

Passage: "Chili peppers relieve indigestion". People who suffer from indigestion after a spicy meal may be shocked and can't believe it. However, this is the conclusion drawn by Italian experts through experiments. They gave the subjects with indigestion a pill containing chili ingredients before meals, and after five weeks, 60% of the subjects' discomfort symptoms were relieved.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above experimental conclusions?
A. A.Capsaicin in chili peppers can block the secretion of a neurotransmitter to some extent
B. B.In this experiment, 5% of the subjects had aggravated their discomfort symptoms
C. C.In another group of subjects who took the pill after meals, 55% of the subjects' discomfort symptoms were relieved
D. D.After paying attention to a healthy diet, people with dyspepsia usually relieve their discomfort within a month
Answer:

sampled: C. In another group of subjects who took the pill after meals, 55% of the subjects' discomfort symptoms were relieved. This suggests that the timing of taking the pill may have an effect on its effectiveness, and therefore refutes the conclusion that chili peppers relieve indigestion.

Passage: Studies have found that insects "breathe" through the stomatal system in their bodies. The stomata are connected to the trachea, and more and more layers of smaller and smaller pores are attached from top to bottom, thus sending oxygen to the whole body. At the current level of oxygen content in the atmosphere, the total length of the stomatal system has reached the limit; if the total length exceeds this limit, the oxygen supply capacity will be insufficient. Therefore, it can be judged that the amount of oxygen can determine the size of insects.Question: Which of the followings, if true, best supports the above argument?
A. A.Studies of invertebrates in the ocean have also found that organisms are larger in colder and oxygen-rich water
B. B.During the Carboniferous period, the concentration of oxygen in the earth's atmosphere was as high as 35%, much higher than the current 21%. At that time, many giant insects lived on the earth, and the dragonfly wingspan was close to one meter
C. C.Small locusts cannot survive in an environment with low oxygen content, especially in an environment with an oxygen concentration of less than 15%, while adult locusts can survive in an environment with 2% oxygen content
D. D.In an environment with high oxygen content and high air pressure, the tested fruit flies lived to the fifth generation, and their body size increased by 20%
Answer:

sampled: B. During the Carboniferous period, the concentration of oxygen in the earth's atmosphere was as high as 35%, much higher than the current 21%. At that time, many giant insects lived on the earth, and the dragonfly wingspan was close to one meter. This supports the argument that the amount of oxygen can determine the size of insects, as during a period of high oxygen concentration, many giant insects lived on Earth.
